title: Biden set to make re-election bid official next week
description: President Joe Biden is preparing to make his intention to seek a second term official next week, with advisers planning to launch his re-election campaign as soon as Tuesday, three sources familiar with the plans told NBC News.

title: Oklahoma sheriff caught on tape boasting about physically confronting local DA, killing reporters
description: The Oklahoma sheriff who was secretly recorded reportedly talking about killing reporters and lynching Black people also boasted about physically confronting the local district attorney and threatening to “whoop his ass,” newly released audio revealed.

title: 4th and 5th suspect arrested in connection with  the shooting at Sweet 16 birthday party in Alabama
description: DADEVILLE, Ala. — A fourth and fifth man were arrested Thursday in connection with the shooting at a Sweet 16 birthday party in Alabama that left four people dead and dozens more injured, authorities said.

title: China's crackdown on deepfakes doesn't stop its apps from finding U.S. audience
description: China is cracking down on deepfakes at home while profiting from them abroad.

title: Charges against Alec Baldwin dropped in fatal ‘Rust’ shooting, attorneys say
description: Charges against Alec Baldwin, stemming from the fatal shooting of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins on the New Mexico set of his Western movie "Rust," have been dropped, his lawyers said Thursday.

title: Twitter begins removal of legacy verified checkmarks
description: It's the end of an era on Twitter.

title: White House defends Hunter Biden probe as 'free from any political interference'
description: The White House dismissed allegations by an IRS agent seeking whistleblower protections to discuss “preferential treatment” in the Hunter Biden investigation.

title: Judge refuses to tell jury in Trump civil rape trial that former president is 'excused'
description: A federal judge in the civil rape trial of former President Donald Trump said that his request for special jury instructions in the case is “premature.”

title: Grandson of man who shot Ralph Yarl says 'fear' and conspiracies consume him
description: One of the grandchildren of Andrew Lester, the Kansas City homeowner who shot Ralph Yarl after the Black teenager had mistakenly gone to the wrong home, is defending the boy's actions and believes police should have acted sooner to arrest his grandfather.

title: Durbin asks Chief Justice John Roberts to testify about Supreme Court ethics rules
description: Senate Judiciary Committee Dick Durbin asked Chief Justice John Roberts on Thursday to testify before Congress in early May about ethics rules for Supreme Court justices and potential reforms.

title: North Carolina man and 6-year-old shot after basketball rolls into suspect's yard, neighbors say
description: A manhunt is underway for a North Carolina man who neighbors say shot another man and his 6-year-old daughter after a basketball rolled into his yard.

title: BuzzFeed News is shutting down
description: BuzzFeed News is shutting down.

title: Democrats advance seven Biden judicial nominees with GOP support amid Feinstein absence
description: Senate Democrats advanced seven of President Joe Biden's judicial nominees through committee Thursday with Republican votes as Sen. Dianne Feinstein remains absent.

title: Influencer with 6-figure income as social media star gives it all up
description: Lee Tilghman is a former wellness influencer who gave up her 9-to-5 job for a lucrative social media career. But behind the scenes, pressures and criticisms began to affect her mental health and led her to give it all up. Tilghman talks about walking away, how she found her own voice again, and shares advice to those with dreams of becoming an influencer.

title: Guantanamo's detainee population is down to 30, and the Biden admin wants to cut it even more
description: The U.S. transfer of a Guantanamo detainee to Algeria Thursday brought the facility's population down to 30. The Biden admin is weighing options to cut it more.

title: SpaceX's giant rocket blasts off on first test flight — and explodes minutes later
description: SpaceX on Thursday tested its next-generation rocket designed for missions to the moon and Mars, ending in an explosion amid cheers from employees who gathered to watch a livestream of the launch.

title: The seat-belt sign is on: Viral videos and climate change boost concerns about turbulence
description: Climate change could be making turbulence worse.

title: CFPB employee sent hundreds of thousands of consumers' data to personal email account
description: A former Consumer Financial Protection Bureau employee sent hundreds of thousands of consumer and financial institution records to their personal email account.

title: House Republicans poised to pass transgender sports ban for schools
description: The Republican-backed bill is the latest GOP salvo in the intensifying culture wars over transgender rights in America.

title: Christians become a target of Israel's rising far-right
description: Christians in the Holy Land say they’re under attack as Israeli-Palestinian violence soars and Jewish extremists appear emboldened by Benjamin Netanyahu's far-right government.

title: 2 dead in possible tornado in Oklahoma as storms hit the state
description: Two people are dead in Oklahoma after a possible tornado struck Wednesday night, authorities said.

title: 'Gobbledygook': Senators frustrated by classified briefing on Pentagon leak
description: Senators in both parties expressed frustration after they received a classified briefing Wednesday afternoon about a Defense Department intelligence leak and its fallout.

title: IRS agent wants whistleblower protections to discuss Hunter Biden tax probe
description: An IRS special agent said to be involved in the federal investigation into Hunter Biden's taxes is seeking whistleblower protections to provide sensitive disclosures about the probe to Congress.

title: How A.I. is changing the film industry
description: Artificial intelligence has recently been tested in the film industry and is beginning to make waves as the future of filmmaking. Director and storyteller Jon Finger created his short, D.A.N., by utilizing mostly A.I. generated images and video.

title: NYC woman sentenced to 21 years for trying to kill her lookalike with a poisoned cheesecake
description: A New York City woman convicted of trying to kill a friend with a sedative-laced cheesecake in an identity theft plot was sentenced to 21 years in prison.
